docs.snippet: A few days ago an Italian publication, Corriere Diplomatico e Consolare--presumably not without official approval-boasted. that "seven LatinAmerican countries are proceeding decisively toward stabilization upon the principles laid down by Premier...
docs.lead_paragraph: A few days ago an Italian publication, Corriere Diplomatico e Consolare--presumably not without official approval-boasted. that "seven LatinAmerican countries are proceeding decisively toward stabilization upon the principles laid down by Premier Benito Mussolini's fascism.
docs.abstract: ed on effect of Fascist propaganda

docs.snippet: The dollar yesterday reversed its recent downward trend and gained slightly in terms of the principal foreign exchanges. The pound sterling lost 1-16 cent and closed at $5.013-16, slightly under its best quotation of the day.
docs.lead_paragraph: The dollar yesterday reversed its recent downward trend and gained slightly in terms of the principal foreign exchanges. The pound sterling lost 1-16 cent and closed at $5.013-16, slightly under its best quotation of the day.

docs.snippet: A better undertone prevailed in most sections of the bond market yesterday in slightly more active trading on the New York Stock Exchange. Improvement was fairly general throughout the list of domestic corporate bonds, with speculative interest again...
docs.lead_paragraph: A better undertone prevailed in most sections of the bond market yesterday in slightly more active trading on the New York Stock Exchange. Improvement was fairly general throughout the list of domestic corporate bonds, with speculative interest again focused on the railroad issues.

docs.snippet: The New York Stock Exchange committee on admissions will ballot on Feb. 24 on a proposal to transfer for $59,000 the membership of H. Duncan Wood of Johnson  Wood, which will continue as a member firm, to J. Burr Bartram.

docs.snippet: Favorable trends which have characterized Latin-American credit and collection conditions for more than two years were reversed in the final quarter of 1937, William Swingle of the foreign department of the foreign credit interchange bureau of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Favorable trends which have characterized Latin-American credit and collection conditions for more than two years were reversed in the final quarter of 1937, William Swingle of the foreign department of the foreign credit interchange bureau of the National Association of Credit Men reported yesterday.
